intro: Carthamus × faurei, commonly known as the African daisy, is a hybrid perennial plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its vibrant, daisy-like flowers that range in color from yellow to orange and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. The flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, adding a striking display of color to gardens.
